Serialized Form

  • Package assign4

    • Class assign4.Administrator extends Employee implements Serializable

    • Class assign4.BadInputException extends java.lang.Exception implements Serializable

    • Class assign4.CommunicationMngr extends java.lang.Object implements Serializable

      • Serialized Fields

        • dealership

          Dealership dealership
          private class reference dealership to Dealership.

        • newMessages

          java.util.concurrent.LinkedBlockingQueue<E> newMessages
          This queue contains a list of messages submitted by customers. We want to answer messages in a first-come first-served manner, hence, we use a queue implementation to store the messages. The next message to be answered is always the message at the head of the queue.

        • answeredMessages

          java.util.Set<E> answeredMessages
          Customer messages that have been answered as well as answer messages generated by employees are added in this set.

          private variable int to store a Customer's Driver's License Number.

          private String phoneNo to store the Customer's Phone Number.

        • email

          java.lang.String email
          private String email to store the Customer's email address.

    • Class assign4.Message extends java.lang.Object implements Serializable

      • Serialized Fields

        • user

          User user
          Who wrote the message.

        • msgText

          java.lang.String msgText

        • date

          java.util.Date date

        • inResponseTo

          Message inResponseTo
          This attribute links a response message (from an employee) to an original message (from a customer). For messages generated by customers, the value of this variable will be null.

    • Class assign4.TransRecords extends java.lang.Object implements Serializable

      • Serialized Fields

        • transactions

          java.util.LinkedHashSet<E> transactions
          A set of all the transactions completed at the dealership. We don't want to allow duplicate transactions but care about the order in which the transactions were completed, hence, we opted in using a LinkedHashSet collection type.

        • dealership

          Dealership dealership
          A reference to a Dealership object. This class field is used for convenience purposes, so we can access the the inventory through the dealership object. The inventory needs to be updated after every completed transaction.

    • Class assign4.Truck extends Vehicle implements Serializable

      • Serialized Fields

        • maxLoadWeight

          float maxLoadWeight
          The maximum allowed load weight of the truck.

        • length

          float length
          The length of the truck (in feet).

    • Class assign4.User extends java.lang.Object implements Serializable

      • Serialized Fields

        • id

          int id
          protected int id.

        • name

          java.lang.String name
          protected String name.

    • Class assign4.UserRecords extends java.lang.Object implements Serializable

      • Serialized Fields

        • users

          java.util.Map<K,V> users
          A collection of the users in our system. We anticipate many user look up operations during system use, hence, we opted for the use of a map collection type, for faster look up. Using a map, allows us to find a user using their id in constant time.

    • Class assign4.Vehicle extends java.lang.Object implements Serializable

      • Serialized Fields

        • vin

          java.lang.String vin
          The Vehicle Identification Number (VIN) of the vehicle.

        • make

          java.lang.String make
          The make of the vehicle.

        • model

          java.lang.String model
          The model of the vehicle.

        • year

          int year
          The production year of the vehicle.

        • mileage

          int mileage
          The mileage counter of the vehicle.

        • price

          float price
          The sale price of the vehicle.

    • Class assign4.VehicleInventory extends java.lang.Object implements Serializable

      • Serialized Fields

        • vehicles

          java.util.LinkedHashSet<E> vehicles
          A set of all the vehicles in the inventory. We don't want to allow duplicate vehicle entries but care about the order in which the vehicles were added in the inventory, hence, we opted for using a LinkedHashSet collection type. In addition, we anticipate a big number of vehicles will have to be removed from the middle of the set as sale transactions are completed. The remove operation in a LinkedHashSet takes constant, O(1) time.
